chapterTitle: Some Lessons From Capital Market History

columns.text: In this problem, we will assess how the Sharpe ratio can help in the given situation and whether it is appropriate to use.

Solving the Sharpe ratio, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Sharpe ratio}&=\dfrac{2.72}{10.99}\\[15 pt]
&=0.24 \approx 0.25
\end{aligned}$$

The Sharpe ratio for the company stocks is $0.25$ which indicates that it is a bad investment since the ratio is less than $1$.
The Sharpe ratio is a very good tool to use especially in diverse portfolios since the investments are not tied down to a single industry, thus there is a lower risk of not profiting.
